definition: lit. their number cannot be counted (idiom); fig. countless/innumerable
to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge
to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)

sentences.english: Most people turn to countless sources of information these days.
sentences.chinese: 當今大多數人要面對不計其數的信息源。

sentences.english: To this day, countless cover versions of the song are played in clubs and at parties.
sentences.chinese: 到今天，俱樂部和派對上放過不計其數的翻唱版。

sentences.english: There are countless people who, ever since their early years, have learned to associate snails with food.
sentences.chinese: 有不計其數的人從小就學會把蝸牛和喫食聯繫在一起。

sentences.english: Jone lost track of the money he spent at the circus.
sentences.chinese: 約翰看馬戲花的錢不計其數。

sentences.english: Our country has a long history, culture, source of long, countless art since ancient times.
sentences.chinese: 我國曆史悠久，文化源長，自古至今書畫家不計其數。

sentences.english: Chocolate shops are numerous (and top-notch) along the grand boulevards and piazzas.
sentences.chinese: 巧克力商店不計其數的分佈在林蔭大道和廣場中。

sentences.english: Tens of thousands of Chinese who studied in the U. S. have the same idea.
sentences.chinese: 不計其數在美國粹習過的中國人都有一樣的概念。

sentences.english: Besides histories, we have many volumes of reminiscences, and biograph ies with number.
sentences.chinese: 除了歷史書籍外，我們還有不計其數的回憶錄和傳記。

sentences.english: Has Dennis really taught a bazillion students?
sentences.chinese: 丹尼斯的學生真的不計其數嗎？

sentences.english: Countless plant-species were introduced by land-and-sea-silk-roads.
sentences.chinese: 由陸海兩條絲綢之路引進的植物種苗不計其數。

sentences.english: In Chinese literature, there are much more lotus-related poetries.
sentences.chinese: 在中國文學裏，與蓮有關的詩詞歌賦，更是不計其數。

sentences.english: In a recession, the individual learns that there are countless ways to economize.
sentences.chinese: 在衰退期，個人學會了不計其數的省錢的辦法。

sentences.english: Having been gynecologist for many years, I have diagnosed a lot of cases.
sentences.chinese: 做了多年的婦產科醫生，我診斷過的病例不計其數。

sentences.english: I met countless others and continue to meet them.
sentences.chinese: 我見過不計其數的人，並且不停的與他們會面。

sentences.english: Considering this, the total number of dragons in the entire palace must be countless.
sentences.chinese: 而整個皇宮裏的龍，就更是不計其數了。

sentences.english: Finally, it made money on the sale of its countless applications.
sentences.chinese: 最終，他通過賣不計其數的應用軟件賺了錢。

definition: can be counted on one's fingers (idiom)/very few
too numerous to mention individually or one by one
to increase steadily/to grow with each passing day
understood by everyone (idiom); well known/a household name
Chow Yun-Fat (1955-), Hong Kong TV and film star
one falls, the next follows (idiom); stepping into the breach to replace fallen comrades/advancing wave upon wave
to be eager to give sth a try (idiom)
to rush like ducks (idiom); the mob scrabbles madly for sth unobtainable/an unruly crowd on a wild goose chase
